extendedIngredients.name: corn tortillas
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 corn tortillas (good quality store-bought or homemade)

extendedIngredients.name: roasted garlic
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 heaping tablespoon Sabra roasted garlic hummus

recipes.title: Roasted Garlic Hummus Breakfast Tacos

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Noir, Riesling, and Sparkling rosé are my top picks for Tacos. Acidic white wines like riesling or low-tannin reds like pinot noir can work well with Mexican dishes. Sparkling rosé is a safe pairing too. The Sanctuary Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir with a 4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 33 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Sanctuary Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir
productMatches.description: The wine at first has a light ruby color. It has aromas of black cherry/cherry and violets with the characteristic Bien Nacido dried herbs and light pepper spice balanced by the toasty oak spice and vanilla influence of French oak barrel aging. There are flavors of cherry and red berry with dried herbs followed by a light pepper spice. The sweet oak spice and vanilla is nicely balanced by the fruit flavors. The wine is concentrated and elegant with a rich mouthfeel and lingering finish.

recipes.instructions: Place a small skillet over medium high heat and another small skillet over medium heat.In a small bowl, beat the eggs with the hummus, water, salt, and pepper.Pour the oil into the skillet over medium heat, then add the eggs. Cook the eggs, stirring occasionally, about 5-7 minutes until they are creamy and just cooked through.While the eggs are cooking, put the tortillas into the other (dry) skillet, one at a time, and let them cook 1-2 minutes on each side to warm them up and brown them a bit.Once the eggs are cooked, divide the eggs between the two tortillas and top with the salsa, avocado, and scallions.

steps.step: Place a small skillet over medium high heat and another small skillet over medium heat.In a small bowl, beat the eggs with the hummus, water, salt, and pepper.

Pour the oil into the skillet over medium heat, then add the eggs. Cook the eggs, stirring occasionally, about 5-7 minutes until they are creamy and just cooked through.While the eggs are cooking, put the tortillas into the other (dry) skillet, one at a time, and let them cook 1-2 minutes on each side to warm them up and brown them a bit.Once the eggs are cooked, divide the eggs between the two tortillas and top with the salsa, avocado, and scallions.
